intro: Potentilla matsumurae var. yuparensis, commonly known as the Yuparensis cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of compound leaves with five leaflets, giving it the common name "cinquefoil." This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
